caption.p: Soshihotang variant prescriptions in Traditional East Asian Medicine.

tr.td: Shihogyejitang (Chai Hu Gui Zhi Tang, Saikokeishito)
SSHT + Gyejitang (SSHT + Cinnamomi Ramulus, Paeoniae Radix)
Gastroenteritis accompanied by abdominal pain; common cold with mild fever, chilling, headache, nausea; and symptoms of delayed common cold
SSHT + Oryeongsan (SSHT + Poria Sclerotium, Polyporus, Alismatis Rhizoma, Cinnamomi Ramulus, Atractylodis Rhizoma)
Watery diarrhea; gastroenteritis; heatstroke; and edema. These conditions accompanied by nausea, loss of appetite (anorexia), thirst and decreased urine output
SSHT + Sohamhyungtang (SSHT + Coptidis Rhizoma, Trichosanthis Semen)
Cough, chest pain originating from coughing
SSHT + Banhahubaktang (SSHT + Poria Sclerotium, Magnoliae Cortex, Perillae Folium)
Pediatric asthma; bronchial asthma; bronchitis; cough; and anxiety. These conditions accompanied by foreign body sensation in the esophagus and throat, palpitations, dizziness, and nausea, etc.
Soshihotang ga Gilgyeong Seokgo (Xiao Chai Hu Tang jia Jiegeng Shigao, Shosaikoto ka Kikyo Sekko)
Tonsillitis and peritonsillitis. These conditions accompanied by sore throat:
